That's a great idea! Taking your sneakers to a cobbler for polishing and conditioning can really help to breathe new life into them. However, I have to clarify that cobblers typically don't polish or condition sneakers. Cobblers usually specialize in repairing and maintaining dress shoes, boots, and other types of leather footwear.

If you're looking to get your sneakers cleaned and conditioned, you might want to consider taking them to a sneaker cleaning and restoration service or a specialty sneaker store that offers cleaning and maintenance services. They'll have the right tools and expertise to clean and condition your sneakers, removing dirt, stains, and odors, and applying protective treatments to keep them looking their best.

If you're looking to give your sneakers a quick clean at home, you can try using a soft-bristled brush to remove any loose dirt or debris, and then use a mild soap and water solution to gently clean the exterior. Be sure to avoid using harsh chemicals or abrasive materials that can damage the materials.

Remember to also check the manufacturer's guidelines for cleaning and maintenance, as different materials may require special care.

It's great that you're taking care of your sneakers, and with a good cleaning and conditioning, they'll be ready for your next jogging routine!
